title: Montonale 2015 Orestilla  (Lugana)
description: Mature orchard fruit and toasted nut aromas lead the nose of this wine while the ripe, medium-bodied palate delivers exotic fruit, yellow pear and candied lemon drop flavors. It closes on a confected note.

title: Maryhill 2014 Proprietor's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: As a 100% varietal wine, blue fruit, vanilla and herb aromas are followed by abundant cherry flavors, with lightly dry tannins backing them up. The oak plays a prominent role.

title: Primosic 2015 Sauvignon (Collio)
description: This opens with subdued oak, dried tropical fruit and bell pepper aromas. On the medium-bodied palate, a confected hint of coconut accents grapefruit and mature peach flavors.

title: Producteurs Plaimont 2015 Beret Blanc  (Saint-Mont)
description: This wine comes from Gascony, where the Gascon and his famous beret are inseparable. This blend of mainly Gros Manseng has some herbal character but it also has yellow fruits, and a ripe edge of honey that softens and fills out the crisp green-fruit flavors. Drink now.

title: Proulx 2016 Willow Creek Farm Rosé of Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: This is the winery's most straight-forward pink, showing red plum, peach, light mulberry and steel aromas. It's all tension upon first sip, but then waves of ripe plum, citrus and brown spice overtake the palate.

title: Mirassou 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This appetizing wine has attention-getting grapefruit and fresh-cut herb aromas, vivid and crisp fruit flavors, light body and a lingering, citrusy finish.

title: Montonale 2014 Orestilla  (Lugana)
description: Toasted oak, citrus and yellow apple aromas lead the nose. They follow through to the medium-bodied palate,. along with a hint of candied lemon. A bitter almond note marks the finish.

title: Joyful Noise 2014 Lazy River Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This sends up scents of grape jam, plum and cherry, and those round and forward fruit flavors combine in the mouth. It's a tasty young wine, with plenty of immediate appeal from its lollipop-rainbow flavors.

title: Judith Beck 2015 Zweigelt (Burgenland)
description: Cinnamon scents and a touch of reduction signal just how fresh this wine is. The ripeness of 2015 is well controlled here, its freshness preserved. Funkiness on the palate provides additional interest.

title: La Rajade 2015 Friulano (Collio)
description: Toasted bread crust, pressed yellow flower and yellow stone fruit aromas lead the way while the linear, slightly lean palate offers yellow apple skin and citrus notes. Bright acidity lends freshness while bitter almond colors the finish.

title: Lone Madrone 2014 Zinfandel (Adelaida District)
description: Fleshy plum and bramble aromas meet crushed riverstone and dust notes on the nose of this appellation blend. Cooked berry, black plum and soil touches arise on the palate, making for a good weekday quaffer.

title: Le Albare 2016 Ca' Bianchi  (Soave)
description: Orchard fruit and white flower aromas meld together in this pretty white. On the bright palate, fresh acidity underscores white peach, Bartlett pear and juicy nectarine suggestions.

title: Lemelson 2014 Thea's Selection Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: A lightly spicy wine, this mixes rather thin red-currant and raspberry flavors. It's pleasantly juicy, clean and fruity, with a quickly fading finish.

title: L'Enclos des Braves 2015 Les Gourmands Rouge Red (Gaillac)
description: A fine, ripe and soft blend of Duras and Braucol, this is a wine that's made to drink young for its fruit. There is a dry background to the fruitiness although it is the red-fruit flavors and balanced acidity that shine. Drink from early 2018.

title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2016 Fleur de Mer Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Bringing together in its name two important aspects of Provence, flower (lavender is a major local crop) and the sea, this wine is soft and fruity, with just the right balance of acidity and ripe fruit flavors. It is refreshing, open and ready to drink.
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2016 Grain de Glace Le Rosé d'Hiver Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: In an effort to persuade us that rosé is not just for the summer, this is a wine ostensibly for winter. In fact, name aside, it could be consumed this summer as well. It is fruity, with a touch of minerality and is ready to drink now.
designation: Grain de Glace Le Rosé d'Hiver
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

title: Hugl-Wimmer 2016 HuglWeine Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: The scent of freshly cut pear peel plays on the nose of this wine. The palate is less expressive but shows lemony freshness and light body. The finish is clean and dry.

title: Sarzotti 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Dark strawberry meets clove spice, licorice and star anise on the nose of this bottling, which takes a little time to open up. The palate offers baked strawberry and vanilla notes, proving likable if not very complex.

title: Sierra Norte 2014 Pasión de Bobal (Utiel-Requena)
description: Roasted smoky plum and berry aromas are slightly oaky. This feels flush, with grabby tannins. Plum and mixed-berry flavors grow more appealing with air, while this tastes roasted and savory on a rugged and tannic finish.

title: Vignobles Brumont 2012 Petit Torus Tannat-Cabernet (Madiran)
description: This is the little brother of Brumont's estate wines such as Montus and Bouscassé. It is all fruit, the 80% Tannat tamed easily, leaving a modicum of tannins to support the juicy black fruit. It is a ripe wine that is very ready to drink.

title: Vignobles de Saint-Tropez 2016 La Bravade Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: With lees aging to give extra richness, the wine is fruity with a fine mineral texture. Apricot and raspberry fruits are right up front along with the intense acidity. Drink this attractive ripe wine now.

title: Viñalba 2014 Reserva Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon (Valle de Uco)
description: Rubbery generic berry aromas are more damp than bright. This feels drying and scrubbing due to rough tannins. Toasty black-plum flavors are short and foresty, while this tastes toasty on a dry finish.

title: Tohu 2016 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Drawn from the cooler Awatere Valley subregion, this is pungent and green. Leafy notes and hints of green tomato accent passion fruit flavors in this medium-bodied wine that finishes crisp and refreshing.

title: Wairau River 2016 Rosé (Marlborough)
description: This Pinot Noir-based rosé offers youthful passion-fruit aromas tempered by hints of red berries—raspberries and strawberries—and even a touch of watermelon. Off-dry (7.9 g/L of residual sugar) on the finish.

title: Kohl 2016 Pennäcker Riesling (Niederösterreich)
description: Lemon zest, earth and citrus pith appear on nose and palate. This is fresh, easy, dry and slender with a pithy core of fruit. Drink soon.

title: Forrest 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: There's a hint of passion fruit, but no more than that; white grapefruit aromas and flavors dominate. This is light in body, with a crystalline edge to the palate, giving it a combination of delicacy and austerity that's appealing on its own.

title: Ferruccio Sgubin 2015 Sauvignon (Collio)
description: Hay, tomato vine and grilled herb aromas follow through to the linear, structured palate, along with a citrusy note of grapefruit and a hint of white stone fruit. Fresh acidity lends a clean finish.

title: Domaine du Tariquet 2016 Chardonnay (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: The wine is light but it also has very fine fruitiness and great balanced acidity. With a creamy texture and touches of yellow fruit as well as citrus, the wine is refreshingly fruity with great final acidity in a ripe rounded context. Drink now.

title: Winzerkeller Andau 2015 Blaufränkisch (Burgenland)
description: Fleshy, easy and ripe notes of plum and black cherry appear immediately. The easygoing palate showcases the same fruit, delivering uncomplicated juiciness. This would also be good chilled.

title: Zantho 2015 Zweigelt (Burgenland)
description: Fleshy cherry defines this wine's nose and palate. It's easy-drinking, juicy and bouncy, with a light body, a little heat on the finish and more of that fleshy cherry fruit.
